title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting Providing bad information copying output AI assistants without verifying validity

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@rstudio.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to Surveydown
text: welcome contributions Surveydown! can contribute many ways: opening issues provide feedback share ideas. fixing typos documentation submitting Pull Request (PR) fix opened issues submitting Pull Request (PR) suggest new features (considered good practice open issue discussion working pull request new feature).

what: To submit a contribution using a Pull Request
title: Contributing to Surveydown
text: Fork repository, clone locally, make changes new branch specific PR. example: Submit pull request. ok submit draft still working like feedback us. always good share open working . ’ll try responsive possible reviewing accepting pull requests. much appreciate contributions!
code: # clone your fork $ git clone https://github.com/<username>/surveydown  # configure for your platform (./configure.sh for linux/mac  or ./configure.cmd for Windows) $ cd quarto-cli $ ./configure.sh  # checkout a new branch $ git checkout -b bugfix/myfix

text: Hu P, Helveston J, Bunea B (2025). sdstudio: Companion GUI surveydown survey platform. R package, https://surveydown.org/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {sdstudio: Companion GUI for the surveydown survey platform},   author = {Pingfan Hu and John Paul Helveston and Bogdan Bunea},   year = {2025},   note = {R package},   url = {https://surveydown.org/}, }

title: Companion GUI for the surveydown survey platform
text: sdstudio companion package support surveydown survey platform. launches Shiny webapp transforms typical code-heavy survey creation workflow accessible Graphical User Interface, making easy create, preview, manage surveys without extensive programming knowledge.

title: Companion GUI for the surveydown survey platform
text: sdstudio package yet CRAN, development version can installed GitHub:

title: Companion GUI for the surveydown survey platform
text: surveydown Studio main application sdstudio - unified Shiny interface complete survey lifecycle management. Launch :

title: Companion GUI for the surveydown survey platform
text: Drag--drop interface intuitive survey construction Basic templates (Default, Question Types, YAML-based) Advanced features (Conditional logic, Random options, Reactive questions) Specialized surveys (Conjoint experiments, Interactive maps, Live polling) Dual-pane editor visual builder code editor (ACE integration) 12 question types including multiple choice, text, numeric, sliders, dates Real-time synchronization visual interface underlying code Undo/redo functionality editing operations Local/DB mode switching local testing database connection workflows

title: Companion GUI for the surveydown survey platform
text: Real-time preview survey build Responsive preview modes: Desktop (widescreen) Mobile (375px) views Automatic refresh survey code changes Interactive testing environment deployment

title: Companion GUI for the surveydown survey platform
text: PostgreSQL database integration connection pooling GSSAPI encryption support automatic fallback options Total responses daily averages Completion rate tracking Cumulative daily response trends (interactive charts) Interactive data table search, filtering, sorting CSV export functionality data analysis Visual connection status indicators detailed feedback

title: Companion GUI for the surveydown survey platform
text: Template System: Choose 15 professionally designed templates ranging basic surveys advanced conjoint experiments interactive visualizations. Visual Survey Builder: Create surveys using intuitive drag--drop interface real-time code synchronization, eliminating need manual coding maintaining full code access. Database Integration: Seamless PostgreSQL connectivity enterprise-grade security (GSSAPI encryption) automatic connection management. Responsive Design: Built Bootstrap 5, providing modern, mobile-friendly interface works across devices. Development Workflow: Switch Local (local testing) DB (database connection) modes one click, supporting iterative survey development testing.

title: Companion GUI for the surveydown survey platform
text: studio supports flexible database connection modes: Configure database connection using environment variables built-Settings interface within studio.
code: # Auto mode (recommended) - tries GSSAPI first, falls back if needed launch()  # Prefer mode - uses GSSAPI if available, plain connection if not   launch(gssencmode = "prefer")  # Disable mode - forces plain connection (useful for VPN environments) launch(gssencmode = "disable")

title: Launch surveydown Studio — launch
text: function launches Shiny app 3 tabs: Build, Preview, Responses. Build tab includes template selection interface creating new surveys.

title: Launch surveydown Studio — launch
text: gssencmode Character string. GSS encryption mode database connection. Defaults "auto". Options include: "auto": Tries "prefer" first, falls back "disable" GSSAPI fails (recommended) "prefer": Uses GSSAPI encryption available, plain connection "disable": Forces plain connection without GSSAPI encryption

title: Launch surveydown Studio — launch
text: return value, called side effects launching Shiny app.

title: Launch surveydown Studio — launch
code: if (interactive()) {   # Launch studio (uses "auto" mode by default)   launch()      # Launch studio with disabled GSS encryption (for VPN connections)   launch(gssencmode = "disable")      # Launch studio with prefer mode (no fallback)   launch(gssencmode = "prefer") }

title: sdstudio 0.1.0
text: Package renamed sdstudio (used sdApps). Launch studio sdstudio::launch(). 3 tabs: Build, Preview, Responses. Build tab: Survey creation 15 pre-defined templates, use . Preview tab: Live-preview survey. Responses tab: Survey responses management. tabs support local DB modes. set DB mode, input database credentials Responses tab.

title: sdstudio 0.0.3
text: launch() now compatible default fence format.

title: sdstudio 0.0.2
text: launch() now 2 sections Construction tab: Structure Code. Structure, pages contents drag-able editing deleting button. Code, survey.qmd app.R files live editable. Preview tab live preview survey Shiny app, “Refresh” button manually refresh preview.

title: sdstudio 0.0.1
text: Initial version.
